1.name: weapon attack
1.effect: Use your weapon to hit a target. To hit a target you must give 2 dice, possibly doing a bonus effect based on the sum of the roll and the weapon used. Then when doing damage removing damage from the target based on its Armor and Ward.

2.name: spell casting
2.effect: Gain Soul Strain to Cast a spell from your Spell list. Soul Strain cost, dice cost, and effect depend on spell.

3.name: use an item
3.effect: Use an item that is from your bag, or is within 1 tile of you in the world.

4.name: move
4.effect: Spend a dice to move your Speed. Swimming and Climbing use two tiles instead of 1. If you give a 1 you lose 1 Speed for this movement. If you give a 6 you gain 1 Speed for this Movement

5.name: grapple
5.effect: Roll a Contested Body Check against a target within 1 tile of you. If you succeed then the target is Grappled.

6.name: push
6.effect: Roll a Contested Body Check against a target within 1 tile of you. If you succeed then the target is pushed 3 tiles away from you.

7.name: overwatch
7.effect: When a target moves into or out of your Weapon range you may spend your Locked Dice to do a Weapon Attack. Reduce your Locked dice value by 2 for this attack.

8.name: lock
8.effect: You may Lock any unused dice at the end of your Turn.

10.name: aquatic life
10.effect: You can only breathe in water.

11.name: strong body
11.effect: When you roll Physical Feats for Lifting or Pulling multiply each roll by 3 times.

12.name: mount
12.effect:
When someone rolls to Handle a Beast on you they do so with an extra dice.
Additionally, you can carry another creature without needing to do a Physical Feats roll.

13.name: hidyhole
13.effect: Cast Pocket Dimension on yourself without needing a container. You cannot take items with you when you enter or leave. You are unconscious while inside and do not need to eat, sleep, or breathe until you leave the Hidyhole.

14.name: movement choice 1
14.effect: Gain Climber and Swimmer, Flight, or Increase your Speed by 2.

15.name: construct
15.effect: Does not require food, water, or air to function.

16.name: deathless
16.effect: Can be revived with a Crafting score of 20 or higher (sum).

17.name: forced soul
17.effect: Get 2 Soul Strain, do not get any spells

18.name: spirit
18.effect: Become Incorporeal until the start of your next turn.

19.name: undead (6,4)
19.effect: The creature is Undead. When this creature hits 0 or less health they roll deaths door rolls.

20.name: equipable
20.effect: Can use Items that it meets the requirements for.

21.name: hover
21.effect: Floats up to 1 tile over the ground (isn't affected by ground based effects).

22.name: strong punches
22.effect: When doing an Attack with a Fist Weapon the damage is equal to half your Level (rounded up) plus 1.

23.name: hearty
23.effect:
Gain additional Max Health equal to your Body.
Additionally, when you roll to lift, pull, or push an object, you roll with Advantage.

24.name: climber
24.effect: Can move your Speed up vertical walls without needing to roll Acrobatics or Athletics or spending extra Speed.

25.name: dual wield
25.effect: Do a one handed Weapon Attack. You can do an additional attack with a different one handed weapon for half damage (rounded down). This second attack is done with a 7 for the sum. Any weapon that does not say specifically it is two handed is one handed.

26.name: obstruct
26.effect: Target creatures cannot move through tiles adjacent to you. They may, however, stop within this area (for instance in doing a melee attack).

27.name: quick runner
27.effect: Gain 1 additional Speed. This can be taken multiple times to gain another additional Speed.

28.name: battle ready
28.effect:
When you do a Melee Weapon Attack dice, if you spend a 1 you may reroll this dice once per turn.
Additionally, when you roll Initiative dice you may roll 2 dice and pick which dice to use.

29.name: defensive duelist
29.effect: When you give a Low Roll for a Melee Weapon Attack you gain 1 Stack of Dodge until the end of your next Rest.

30.name: tag team
30.effect:
When you attack a target while another ally is within 1 tile of that target, you may roll an additional dice and pick which rolled dice activates effects.
Additionally, if you are standing next to an Ally, both you and the Ally get Advantage on Body checks.

31.name: critical
31.effect:
When you give a sum attack of 12 for a Melee Weapon Attack dice, you do double damage for that attack.
Additionally, when you give two or more 6's for a roll you may add 3 to that roll without spending another dice.

32.name: disarm
32.effect: Do a Melee Attack, this attack does no damage. If the target is holding an item they drop the item sending it 3 tiles away. This may or maynot start combat depending on situation.

33.name: improved auras
33.effect: Your Auras have an increased Range of 1 tile.

34.name: death's reaper
34.effect: When you kill a creature with a Melee Attack. Regain one of the dice spent on this attack.

35.name: guarding aura
35.effect:
You know how many creatures are within your Aura, even if they are Hidden. At the beginning of your turn, for every creature in your Aura you get 1 Armor Health. If you do not have an Aura you get one with the following effect: 
Radiating Aura: Spend a dice to toggle on or off this Aura. You can only have one Aura active at a time. While this Aura is active you emanate a soft glow illuminating everything within 2 tiles of you.

36.name: defender
36.effect:
When you use Overwatch and you hit a creature. That creature’s Speed is set to 0 and gets Webbed this turn.
Additionally, you know if a creatures intentions are hostile without needing to do a Discern Others Intentions roll.

37.name: fortify
37.effect: Gain an amount of Armor Health equal to your Level. You cannot do this action more than 3 times per Rest.

38.name: combo finisher
38.effect: If you hit the same creature twice this turn you can do another Weapon Attack without spending more dice, this roll is always a 6. You cannot use this feature more than once per turn.

39.name: paladin aura
39.effect:
While you have your Aura up, you treat the area your Aura covers as your attack range for attacks made through Overwatch. If you do not have an Aura you get one with the following effect: Spend a dice to toggle on or off this Aura you can only have one Aura active at a time. While this Aura is Active a soft glow appears within 2 tiles of you.
Additionally, when you hit an overwatch attack the effects of your aura are applied immediately.

40.name: blessed/cursed caster
40.effect:
You have been gifted with power. You can cast Bless or Weak Curse once per Rest without gaining Soul Strain. 
Additionally, all spells you cast do an extra 1 damage to Undead.

41.name: protected
41.effect: When you are put on Death’s Door, gain 2 stacks of Ward.

42.name: dagger master
42.effect:
When attacking with a Dagger you may only give a 6 instead of 2 dice to do a Weapon Attack.
Additionally, when you Scavenge you find 1 extra item each time you succeed.

43.name: spear master
43.effect:
When you activate a Spear's Weapon effect the Range is increased by 1 tile.
Additionally, when you do a running jump you can do a Pole Vault with your Spear instead giving 4 tiles per activation instead of 2.

44.name: hammer master
44.effect: When you activate a Hammer's Weapon effect you can knock the target down instead of knocking them back.

45.name: axe master
45.effect: When you activate a Axe's Weapon effect you do triple damage to Armor instead of double.

46.name: pitcher
46.effect: Double the Throw Range for all items you Throw. Items that don't have a displayed Throw Range have a Throw Range of 3.

47.name: bull rush
47.effect: Move up to half your speed in a strait line in any direction, you may move through creatures during this move. Do a Body Contest against any creature within 1 tile during the move. On Success, knock the target back 3 tiles away from your path.

48.name: cleave
48.effect: Do a Melee Weapon Attack against all target's in front of you (Directly in front, to the left, and right of that tile). You can only do this once per turn.

49.name: rip and tear
49.effect: Do a Melee Weapon Attack, if you activate the Weapons effect, give the target an additional 1 stack of Bleed.

50.name: bloodhound
50.effect: Gain 2 extra Speed when moving to a Marked or Bleeding (has Bleed stacks) creature.

51.name: bashing strike
51.effect:
Do a Melee Attack, this attack does no damage instead giving Stun 2. On a Low Roll give the target 1 Stun instead. On a High Roll give the target 3 Stun instead.
Alternatively, if the target is unaware of you you can do a Body Contest against the target. On success the target is knocked unconscious for 1 minute (6 turns), until another creature spends 2 dice to wake them up, or they take damage.

52.name: swimmer
52.effect: Can move your Speed through normal liquids without needing to roll Acrobatics or Athletics or spending extra Speed.

53.name: jumper
53.effect: When you roll Physical Feats to Jump, add 2 to the distance jumped.

54.name: mental mage
54.effect: If your Max Soul Strain is 0 it becomes 2. Otherwise, increase it by 2.

55.name: mark
55.effect: Apply 3 stacks of Marked to a target you can see within Range 6.

56.name: motivate
56.effect: Target a creature you can see. Give the target the dice you used on this skill. This can be used outside of Combat when rolling a dice for a check. If you and the target both roll this check you spend one of your dice in the check, otherwise roll Mind then spend a dice.

57.name: crippling shot
57.effect:
Do a Ranged Weapon attack, this attack reduces the target's Speed by 2, to a maximum of 4 reduced from this trait, until the begining of your next turn.
Alternatively, throw a Bola that trips and sets the Speed of the target to 0. Until the end of the target's next turn.

58.name: marking shot
58.effect: Do a Ranged Weapon Attack, it gives them 2 stacks of Marked. If you activated your weapons effect give them another stack of Marked. This cannot be used more than once in a turn.

59.name: weak spot
59.effect: When a Creature attacks a Target you Marked they may add 1 to weapon or spell sums. They may only do this once per turn.

60.name: forethought
60.effect:
When you do a Weapon Attack, you may add an additional dice to activate weapon effects.
If you replace a dice with your Locked dice you may add half of the replaced dice's value (rounded down) to the locked dice value. This effect does not happen if the Locked dice value is 6.

61.name: train of thought
61.effect: If you don't have a locked die at the end of your turn lock a 3. This effect can go off once every minute (6 Turns).

62.name: marked as lost and found
62.effect:
When Searching for a Hidden target, if you find something you can apply 2 Stacks of Marked without spending another dice.
Additionally, you get Advantage when you search for a target that you are familiar with. (Creatures you just met do not count)

63.name: recalculate
63.effect: You may flip this dice to show its opposite face. (1⇔6, 2⇔5, 3⇔4) You can only do this once per turn, and a number of times equal to your COMBAT DICE per Rest.

64.name: size up
64.effect: Target a creature you can see. You determine which of the target's Primary Skills (Body | Mind | Soul) are highest and lowest. You do not know the values of these Skills.

65.name: change of thinking
65.effect: Set a dice to 4. You can do this a number of times equal to your COMBAT DICE per Rest.

66.name: duplicity
66.effect: When you roll multiple dice for a Weapon attack, you may use all of the dice to activate an effect rather than just 1.

67.name: longer marks
67.effect: When you Mark a creature, increase its marked stacks by 3.

68.name: outsmart
68.effect: When a creature that you can see rolls you may replace one of the dice rolled with your Locked dice.

69.name: illusion of choice
69.effect: Set a dice to any value you want. You can only do this once per turn, and a number of times equal to your COMBAT DICE per Rest.

70.name: think ahead
70.effect: Split a dice. Cannot split a 1.

71.name: enhanced motivate
71.effect: When you use Motivate, increase the dice’s value by 1. This effect doesn’t apply if the dice is already 6.

72.name: command
72.effect: Give a creature the 2 dice used on this action. They may then use these 2 dice to do any action on their character sheet during your turn. You cannot use this ability more than once per turn.

73.name: yoyo
73.effect: Move your Speed. At the end of the turn teleport back to where you started the turn.

74.name: telepathy
74.effect: Bind your mind to a willing creature's mind. You can use your action on later turns to see/hear through their senses or send/receive simple messages. You can only be bound to one creature at a time.

75.name: create familiar
75.effect: At the end of a Rest you can create a Familiar (See Creatures). You may pick its type (Animal, Construct, Monstrosity, Planar, or Undead) and appearance each time it is created. You can control up to your level of personal minions with your dice, but they must all be given the same Command. If the familiar is not given any commands it does not do any action. When you spend a dice to move you may also have the familiar move as well.

76.name: illusionary mage
76.effect: When you cast an Illusion spell you can create it with both sound and visuals.

77.name: meditate
77.effect:
Grants the Action Meditate which uses Soul:
5+ Spend 1 Hour to remove 1 Soul Strain  
7+ Spend 1 Hour to remove 3 Soul Strain
21+ Spend 1 Hour to remove Half your Soul Strain (rounded down)
These can be done multiple times in a roll without increasing the time spent Meditating.

78.name: conjure shield
78.effect: Gain 1 Soul Strain and spend your Locked dice to activate. Create a spectral flat shield shape between you and whatever is attacking you. This shield has 6 health. The damage first goes to the shield then to you. The shield cannot block Area damage and goes away at the end of your next turn.

79.name: focused
79.effect: You do not lose Focus from taking damage.

80.name: familial flock
80.effect: You create up to 2 Familiars (or equivalent such as Personal Construct) at the end of a Rest. At level 5 it becomes 3 familiars and at level 8 it becomes 4.

81.name: soul ward
81.effect: When you take damage you can gain Ward 1, and gain 2 Soul Strain, then take the damage. This effect cannot happen if you are at max Ward.

82.name: soulbound familiar
82.effect: Your Familiar gains the spell Swapper with a Soul Strain cost of 1, however it only can target the Owner (you). The Owner (you) can cast spells through the familiar as if they (you) where the familiar. Spells cast this way target the familiar not the Owner. (Soul Skip teleports the familiar not the Owner)

83.name: mirror match
83.effect:
Gain 3 Soul Strain to target all creatures within 3 tiles of you, excluding yourself. These creatures make a Soul roll against the 3 dice given. You make an Illusionary clone of that creature. On fail the clone has 2 Ward, on success it has 1. Any action that would effect a creature other than itself will get sucked into the clone. 
Additionally, if the creature tries to move past the clone it must win a Soul contest against you. The clone has 1 health and is magical in nature.

84.name: summoners command
84.effect: At the start of your turn you may have all of your personal minions (constructs, undead, familiars, summons etc) move without you spending a dice.

85.name: soul shielded
85.effect:
You can have a maximum of 5 Ward instead of 3 and gain an additional Ward on Rest.
Additionally, While you have Ward you cannot become dirty or wet by unwelcomed sources.

86.name: acceleration
86.effect: Gain Speed equal to half your current Soul Strain (rounded down). This effect goes away at the end of your turn.

87.name: dreams of the future
87.effect: At the end of a Rest roll a number of dice equal to your Level and Lock one of them.

88.name: rune maker
88.effect: At the end of a Rest you can craft 2 Lesser Runes of your choosing. If you craft different runes using this feature the oldest rune gets replaced. This skill can be taken multiple times to increase the number of runes by 1.

89.name: discover rune of soul skip
89.effect:
You have learned how to create a Unique Rune of Soul Skip. At the end of a rest, you can create 1 Rune of Soul Skip and apply it to an item. Only 1 instance of this rune can exist at any time and attempting to create a second will destroy the first.
Rune of Soul Skip: You can cast Soul Skip without gaining Soul Strain a number of times per day equal to your Arcana reseting at Dawn.

90.name: runic carver
90.effect: At the end of a Rest you can craft 1 Greater Rune and 1 Lesser Runes of your choosing. If you craft different runes using this feature you replace the preveously made one of the same level.

91.name: runic master
91.effect: At the end of a Rest you can craft 2 Greater Runes of your choosing. If you craft different runes using this feature the oldest rune gets replaced.

92.name: combative running
92.effect:
You have figured out how to improve the flow of runic magic through your tools. Weapons you wield and armor you wear can have an additional rune inserted into it. 
Additionally, at the end of a Rest craft a Lesser Rune. This rune must be put in your weapon or armor and will be replaced if you make another.

93.name: arcane armory
93.effect:
You can cast pocket dimension on items you have applied runes to. When you cast pocket dimension in this way you target only the runed item, 
Additionally you can equip or unequip armor or weapons this way.

94.name: blade wave
94.effect:
You can channel Arcane energy into a Melee Weapon Attack and expel it to attack at range. You can make a Melee Weapon Attack with an additional 4 Range. This attack does half damage (rounded down), and does not activate the weapons effect. On a Low Roll you reduce this damage by 1. On a High Roll you may activate the Weapons effect.
Additionally, once per day you may surge this energy. Each creature in a 6 tile line in front of you takes your Weapon's full damage. This attack does not activate the weapons effect. On a Low Roll you reduce this damage by 1. On a High Roll you may activate the Weapons effect.

95.name: discover rune of absorption
95.effect:
You have learned how to create a Unique Rune of Absorption. At the end of a rest, you can create 1 Rune of Absorption and apply it to any item. Only 1 instance of this rune can exist at any time and attempting to create a second will destroy the first.
Rune of Absorption: Once a day, you may cast the spell Counterspell without gaining soul strain. If a spell is successfully countered then this Rune has additional effects based what it is applied to.
Weapon: If a spell is successfully countered the weapon glows with energy reminiscent of the spell countered and your next Weapon Attack has a -2 to the High Roll threshhold and the attack does 2 additional damage.
Armor: If a spell is successfully countered the armor glows with energy reminiscent of the spell countered and you gain armor equivalent to double the countered spell's Soul Strain with a minimum of 2.
Item: You counterspell with a value of 6 regardless of what value the locked die spent is.

96.name: runic augmentation
96.effect: You are able to cast Flesh Shaper on yourself at will. However, the effects are Permanent instead of temporary.

97.name: discover rune of poison
97.effect:
You have learned how to create a Unique Rune of Poison. At the end of a rest, you can create 1 Rune of Poison and apply it to any item. Only 1 instance of this rune can exist at any time and attempting to create a second will destroy the first.
Rune of Poison: This Rune has effects based what it is applied to.
Weapon: On hit give the target Poisoned until the begining of your next turn. If the weapon already applies this effect increase its duration by 1 turn.
Armor: You cannot become Poisoned, and heal 1 when you would be poisoned.
Item: Once per day you may make a poison with a crafting value of 2 or less without needing to roll. This effect resets at Dawn.

98.name: complex brews
98.effect: You can brew a potion with 2 effects.

99.name: poisoned strikes
99.effect:
When you hit an attack with a weapon that has no poison (or similar effect) on it you may give the target a stack of Poisoned until the start of your next turn.
Additionally, when you apply a potion or Poison effect to an item, it gets twice the number of uses before the potion or Poison runs out.

100.name: skin absorbing
100.effect: You can throw potions and poisons to appy their effect. Potions and poisons thrown this way have their effect time reduced by 30 seconds (5 turns) to a minimum of 6 seconds (1 turn). (Items without a throw range have a default throw range of 3.)

101.name: potent alchemy
101.effect: Potions and poisons you brew last 30 seconds (5 turns) longer, or have 2 more charges when applied to an item. (This is taken into effect after all other bonus effects.)

102.name: double dosing
102.effect: Potions and poisons you brew can be used twice before it is consumed.

103.name: potions of power
103.effect: You can brew potions that when ingested allow the drinker to cast a spell with a Soul Strain cost of 2 or less, once. This spell is chosen appon making the Potion, and goes away at the end of a Rest.

104.name: scroll crafting
104.effect: At the end of a Rest you can create a magical Scroll. This scroll can contain any Spell you know when crafting, and can be used by anyone. The person using the scroll can cast the spell on the scroll for half its Soul Strain cost if they know the spell or at full cost if they don't. You can only have 1 scroll written with this trait at a time, if another one is written the first one loses its power.

105.name: shaped explosions
105.effect: Cast an area of effect spell, with a sum reduction of 4. When you do, you can choose up to 3 creatures within the area. Those creatures succeed on the save without needing to roll.

106.name: spell manipulator
106.effect:
Gain 1 Soul Strain then pick on of the following:  
Soul Slinger: The next spell you cast this turn has an extra 4 Range. 
Maintain Spell Form: The next spell you cast this turn has its duration is increased by an extra 2 turns. 
Intensify Spell: The next spell you cast this turn does 1 extra damage.

107.name: spell book crafting
107.effect:
At the end of a Rest you can create a magical Spell Book. This book can contain up to 3 Spells you know when crafting, and can be used by anyone. The person using the book can cast any spell in the book without gaining Soul Strain. Once a Spell is cast from the book that spell is then magically removed from the book. 
Alternatively you can remove a Spell page from the book turning it into a Spell Scroll which burns away at Dawn. You can only have 1 book written with this trait at a time, if another one is written the first one loses its power.

108.name: discover rune of gravity
108.effect:
You have learned how to create a Unique Rune of Gravity. At the end of a rest, you can create 1 Rune of Gravity and apply it to any item. Only 1 instance of this rune can exist at any time and attempting to create a second will destroy the first.
Rune of Gravity: the wielder of the item this rune is applied to can activate it as a # (one dice) action. When you activate it you choose which effect takes place. This effect can be turned off for an additional # (one dice) action.
1. Your Gravity is inverted, making it so you will fall upwards. You can take fall damage from this and can leave the atmosphere with this rune.
2. Your Gravity is increased, making you immune to displacements, decreasing your speed by 2
3. Your Gravity is decreased, effects of displacements are doubled and when you do a Physical Feats roll for jumping your jump height is increased by 1.
These effects can be activated a number of times equal to your Arcana, resetting at dawn.

109.name: reactive explosions
109.effect: When you do an area of effect spell, you can set one of the required dice to 5 (You still spend 3 dice, you just change the value of one dice).

110.name: taunt
110.effect: Make a Contested Charm roll against a creature you can see. On success the creature cannot willingly move away from you and must spend a dice to move closer if possible.

111.name: jackpot
111.effect: When you spend only 6’s on a roll you may add 3 to the roll.

112.name: universal language
112.effect: You can attempt to converse with Humanoids, Planar, Monstrosities, or Mythic creatures who cannot understand your spoken language. When you roll to Convince Someone of Something you can target one of these creatures, with a -7 penalty to the sum.

113.name: first impression
113.effect: When interacting with a creature for the first time, you gain an additional dice to the first Charm roll you make against it.

114.name: dance performer
114.effect:
Gain a new action called Performance: Dance, which can be used with Charm or Body. It does the following:
6- Everyone boo's you and tries to get you to stop.
7+ Dance majestically attracting common people, commoners will watch you perform. You may get some coin at the end.
14+ Dance majestically attracting most people, most will watch you perform. You may get some coin at the end.
21+ Dance majestically attracting nobility, nobles will watch you perform. You may get some coin at the end.
28+ Dance majestically attracting royalty, royals will watch you perform. You may get some coin at the end.

115.name: rain dance
115.effect:
When you do a Performance: Dance, you may cast one of the following spells without gaining Soul Strain: 
7+ Conjure Fog
14+ Rain
21+ __
28+ __

116.name: sword dance
116.effect: When you do a Performance: Dance, you may do attacks while performing, gaining 1 extra damage if you would attract most people, 2 extra damage for nobility, and 3 extra damage for royalty. This effect lasts while you are dancing. If you gain stacks of Stun or lose Health you stop Dancing. (Armor Health is not health).

117.name: shock and awe
117.effect:
Do a Charm contest against a creature you can see. On Success, the creature gains 3 stacks of Stun.
Additionally, when you are Performing you may roll Charm to redo the Performance, taking the effects of the higher roll.

118.name: fancy feet
118.effect:
When you do a Performance: Dance, when you take damage from a Ranged Attack, you can spend your locked dice to half this damage (rounded up).
Additionally, you can ____

119.name: the show must go on
119.effect:
When you fail a Death's Door roll, you can instead turn it into a success. You can do this once per Rest.
Additionally, when you are Performing you cannot gain stacks of Stun or be interrupted by Charm Rolls.

120.name: act like you belong
120.effect: When making a check to make pass as a member of a group or to blend in with a group of people, you may roll Charm instead of Thievery.

121.name: expose
121.effect:
Do a Charm contest against a creature you can see within 6 tiles of you. On a success, give the creature 2 stacks of Stun every turn for 30 seconds (3 turns). On a failure, they are immune to this feature for 1 minute.
Additionally, When you succeed on a Discern others Intentions roll and determine that a character is not telling the truth (roll at least a 9+) that character has disadvantage on checks for a minute.

122.name: clueless
122.effect: When a creature makes a Charm check to Discern your Intentions reduce their sum by 4.

123.name: ventriloquism
123.effect:
Do a contested Soul roll against a creature within range 6. On success you make the target recites a sentence as well as it can and in the same tone.
They believe the sentence was their own and have no memory of the magic. On failure they someone tried to cast magic on them but not what it was or who cast it.

124.name: vocal mimicry
124.effect: When you cast an Illusion spell with sound you can roll Charm to try to mimic someone's voice. You do not need to roll Charm to mimic your own voice.

125.name: change face
125.effect:
You can magically change your appearance to look like another. This illusion covers your entire body letting you change clothes, race, sex, and general appearance.
It is, however, still an illusion and touching it reveals the illusion. A creature can make a Core Roll against you to discern if it is an illusion.
If a creature discovers this illusion then they are able to see through it regardless of what you look like.

126.name: intrusive soul
126.effect:
You can cast Intrusive Thoughts without gaining Soul Strain. 
Additionally you can use Charm instead of Soul when using the save.

127.name: rendition
127.effect:
Using Artist's tools or a spellcasting focus, you can cast the Minor Illusion spell. When cast in this way, the illusions created can by physically interacted with.
They are unarmored and have 1 hit point. 
Additionally, if the spell is focused on for its duration, the object does not disappear when the spell ends.

128.name: who are you
128.effect: Do a contested Soul roll against a creature within Range 6. On success, you make the creature forget all knowledge associated to your identity. Actions you undertook are still remembered by the creature but you all memories of you are replaced with that creatures idea of what the perpetrator might look like. Creatures that know you well will remember you and know who you are, but will have no memory of what actions you took. They will make up a reason for the memory loss and have no memory of the magic. On failure they know someone tried to cast magic on them but not what it was or who cast it.

129.name: rocket jump
129.effect: You take half damage from explosions you detonate (rounded up). The explosions you create can be used as tools for propelling yourself through the air. Whenever you detonate an explosion within 1 tile of yourself, you can launch yourself in a direction of your choosing up to 4 tiles. If the explosion would give you knockback, such as with the Poprocks Spell, you can replace this distance with the knockback from the explosion.

130.name: potent grenades
130.effect: Grenades you create or throw have an additional 1 tile effect radius, and do 1 additional damage.

131.name: apprentice smith
131.effect:
At the end of a Rest you can modify a Weapon or Armor to remove or add one of the following effects: 
Glow: Give the item the spell Glow. Glow can be cast by the user. (Weapons with this tag can be used to cast spells)
Light Weight: Give armors +1 Speed. Give weapons -1 to the High Roll threshold.
---
An item can only have one of the changes applied to it. Applying an additional change to an item replaces the first change.

132.name: tunneler
132.effect:
Grants the Action Tunneler which can be used with Body or Crafting:
7+ Remove 1 tile cubed worth of soft material such as dirt or lose stones.
11+ Remove 1 tile cubed worth of dense material such as constructed stone or thick wood.
14+ Remove 1 tile cubed worth of reinforced material such as metal walls or solid stone.
You can do an of the above as many times as you can when you roll.

133.name: flaming blow
133.effect: When you activate a Melee weapon's effect you may it give the target an additional 1 stack of Burn. You can light or snuff out small fires using your weapon instead of a

134.name: weapon smithing master
134.effect: At the end of a Rest you can create an enhanced weapon, does 1 additional damage, reduces the Low Roll Threshold by 1, and can be sold for twice its value (on average). You can only gain this benefit if you wield this weapon.

135.name: reforge
135.effect: When holding a Melee weapon, you can instantly reforge it into another Melee weapon of equivalent crafting value. Any Runes or attributes applied to it from other traits are retained.

136.name: turreted weapon
136.effect:
Spend 2 dice to turn one of your weapons into a semi automated Turret. If the Turret is destroyed the weapon drops and is broken. The weapon can be picked up by you and returns to being a normal weapon.
You can control up to your level of personal minions with your dice, but they must all be given the same Command. When you spend a dice to move you may also have the turrets move as well.

137.name: steam weapons
137.effect:
At the end of a Rest you can create 1 of 3 specialty weapons. You may only have 1 of these weapons at a time. See Weapons for more info.
The Bronze Bolter; a repeating crossbow, 
Steamthrower: a steam based Flamethrower
Clockwork Cannon; a large blunderbuss that shoots scrap.

138.name: overclock
138.effect: Give a weapon a stack of Overclock to a maximum of 5 stacks, increasing its Damage by 1 per stack of Overclock. When the weapon hits a target it loses all stacks of Overclock.

139.name: grappling hook
139.effect: Target a location or target within within Range 6. If you target a location Pull yourself to that location. If you target an object or creature pull a light object to you or make a Mind Attack. On hit pull the target 3 tiles to you.

140.name: simple golem
140.effect: When you use the Create Familiar at the end of a Rest you can instead create a Personal Golem (See Creatures). This replaces the familiar, dispelling the familiar if one already exists. You can control up to your level of personal minions with your dice, but they must all be given the same Command. If the golem is not given any commands it does not do any action. When you spend a dice to move you may also have the golem move as well.

141.name: spectral grenade
141.effect: Gain 1 Soul Strain. Create a Spectral Grenade (it counts as a grenade for the purposes of other traits) within the palm of your hand. The grenade has a throw range of 6 and lasts 1 minute or until thrown (throwing is ##). The grenade detonates with Burst 1. All target's within this area take 1 damage.

142.name: simple magical craftsman
142.effect: You can craft Lesser Magic items, excluding potions.

143.name: spectral artillery
143.effect: Gain 2 soul strain, then pick up to half your level (rounded down) locations within 12 tiles. A spectral artillery shot is fired from some far off place. Next turn creatures within Burst 1 of the chosen location roll Mind against the 3 dice given when activating. On failure they take 3 damage. On success, they take 1 damage.

144.name: golem ranger module
144.effect:
Your Golem’s Soul Weapon gets +4 range and gains Armor Piercing. 
Additionally, it’s Armor Becomes Light.

145.name: master of magic items
145.effect: You can be Bound to twice as many magic items.

146.name: magical craftsman
146.effect: You can craft Greater Magic items, excluding potions.

147.name: trap maker
147.effect:
Make one of 3 traps listed below. Each trap costs 5 gold to craft, and covers 1 tile or item. Traps can be reclaimed if unused. Creatures roll a Nature contest to detect the trap.
Tripwire: A small hidden wire which will knock over any creature that steps on it. Can trigger non magical items. 
Snare: A loop of rope that when triggered Grapples and lifts its prey 2 tiles off the ground. 
Popmine: A plate that when activated knocks its prey 3 tiles in a direction. The direction is decided during the trap's creation.

148.name: knowledge of the forest
148.effect:
You can use Nature when rolling to Remember information about: your approximate location, local flora, fauna, or aproximate time of day (even underground).
Additionally, when you Scroundge in area you are familiar with, you gain 1 extra item for every success.

149.name: natures friend
149.effect:
You gain Advantage when rolling to Handle a Beast or Track a Creature.
Additionally, when you first tame a Beast you can control the Beast as if it was a Personal Minion.

150.name: scrounger
150.effect:
Replace your Scrounge with the following:
5+ Find 1 raw item (such as wood, herbs, or metal scraps), Travel Meal, or a clean water source.   
7+ Find 1 small or tiny non-magical item, Cheap Meal, or a unique plant or animal from the local environment.
14+ you may heal yourself or another creature 3 Health with local medicines. 
These can be done multiple times in a roll.

151.name: improved traps
151.effect:
Make one of 3 traps listed below. Each trap costs 5 gold to craft, and covers 1 tile or item. Some traps can be reclaimed if unused. Creatures roll a Nature contest to detect the trap.
Pitfall: A 5 tile deep hole covered in camouflage that breaks when stepped on. The edge is covered in a slick surface which prevents climbing up it. (Not reclaimable)
Poison: A gas canister that when triggered unleashes poisonous gas. The gas explodes in Burst 3, Blinding any creature inside. At the start of a creatures turn, they take 1 damage if they are in the gas.
Goo: An orb of strange goo that bursts on touch. The goo explodes in Burst 3, giving all target's in this area Burn 3 and destroying 3 Armor.

152.name: heightened scenses
152.effect:
You can see in poorly light areas as if they were illuminated. 
Additionally, you get Advantage when doing Perception rolls.

153.name: one with nature
153.effect:
You do not get attacked by creatures with the Beasts type unless you attack them. 
Additionally, you get an extra 2 dice when interacting with creatures with the Beasts type.

154.name: viney slam
154.effect: Do a ground slam. Vines burst out of the cracks left in the ground. In a 3 tile cone in front of you all creatures in this area make a Body roll against the 3 dice given. On failure the creature is grappled until the start of your next turn.

155.name: nature's bind
155.effect: You can Grapple someone using earth or plants within 4 tiles of you instead of having touch. All other rules still apply to the Grapple.

156.name: draw roots
156.effect:
Heal 1. You must be standing on soil or stone to do this. You can do this a number of times equal to your Nature stat per Rest.
Alternatively, you can emplant yourself to the surface you are on. While emplanted you cannot be affected by Knockback, and get Double Advantage on other effects trying to move you.

157.name: volcano aura
157.effect:
Spend a dice to toggle on or off this Aura you can only have one Aura active at a time. While this Aura is active molts of fire start bubbling within 2 tiles around you, this area gives 2 Burn to any creature, other than yourself, that starts its turn in it.
Additionally, while active ice melts, water dries, and flora wilts in this area, potentially removing difficult turain.

158.name: sandstorm aura
158.effect:
Spend a dice to toggle on or off this Aura you can only have one Aura active at a time. While this Aura is active you make a dense Sandstorm within 2 tiles around you, this area is heavily obscured giving all creatures in this area Advantage on Hiding rolls.
Additionally, while this Aura is active you take half damage from Ranged Weapon Attacks.

159.name: forest aura
159.effect:
Spend a dice to toggle on or off this Aura you can only have one Aura active at a time. While this Aura is active you stimulate the growth of plants within 2 tiles of you. This area acts as difficult turrain for anyone other than yourself. 
Additionally, any plants within this area blossom or bloom, and grass or moss grows if their wasent plantlife there already.

160.name: canopy
160.effect: A target on a tile directly behind you becomes Hidden from any creature in front of you. Creatures that stand on the side or behind you can see the Hidden target. You cannot Hide a target larger than yourself.

161.name: overgrowth
161.effect: You become noticeably larger. You get Advantage on Body rolls.

162.name: warden's grasp
162.effect: Once per turn when you hit a target with a Melee Attack, you can do a Grapple check on them without spending extra dice.

163.name: guarding aura
163.effect: You know how many creatures are within your Aura, even if they are Hidden. At the beginning of your turn, for every creature in your Aura you get 1 Armor Health. If you do not have an Aura you get one with the following effect: Spend a dice to toggle on or off this Aura you can only have one Aura active at a time. While this Aura is Active a soft glow appears within 2 tiles of you.

164.name: hidden in the bush
164.effect: You can use Nature instead of Thieving to Hide, and can travel while Hidden at a normal Speed instead of 1 tile slower.

165.name: marked as prey
165.effect:
When you damage a Marked target, you do an extra Damage and reduce the target's Mark stacks by 1. 
Additionally, you know the rough direction of creatures you Mark.

166.name: marked as dangerous
166.effect:
When a target you Marked does damage. You may remove 1 Stack of Marked to reduce the damage by 1. This cannot reduce the damage below 1.
Additionally, if the target is a creature, you know the creatures highest Stat and Substat (name and number).

167.name: mark of the hunter
167.effect: Your Marks don't go away while you are within 2 Large tiles (4,320x4,320 tiles) the Marked Creature.

168.name: elemental shots
168.effect:
You infuse ammo with elemental energy. Make a Ranged Weapon Attack. The infused ammo does 1 additional damage. 
Additionally, choose one of the following effects: 
Fire: On hit, give the target 2 stacks of Burn 
Ice: On hit, give the target 1 stack of Stun 
Earth: On hit, the target is knocked back 2 tiles 
Wind: On hit, another target within 2 tiles takes half damage (rounded down).

169.name: longer marks
169.effect: When you Mark a creature, increase its marked stacks by 3.

170.name: nature speak
170.effect: You can have simple conversations with animals, and can use Nature instead of Charm when talking to them.

171.name: spirit animal
171.effect:
When you use the Create Familiar at the end of a Rest you can instead create a Spirit Animal (See Creatures). This replaces the familiar, dispelling the familiar if one already exists. 
You can control up to your level of personal minions with your dice, but they must all be given the same Command. If the spirit is not given any commands it does not do any action. When you spend a dice to move you may also have the spirit move as well.

172.name: animal form
172.effect: Gain 2 Soul Strain, you can transform into an animal (creature with just the Beast tag) that you have seen. The creature must have a Difficulty Rating (DR) your level or lower. The Shapeshift lasts until dispelled or you die. While transformed you replace your Character sheet with the Animal’s sheet. Your Health and Ward remain unchanged.

173.name: poisoned magic
173.effect:
When you effect a target with a spell that costs Soul Strain you may give them a stack of Poisoned until the start of your next turn. 

Alternatively, you can roll Nature instead of Arcana to make poisons, doing so without spending gold.

174.name: plant growth
174.effect: Gain 2 Soul Strain. Make plants in Burst 3 grow explosively. This area becomes rough turrain for 1 minute (6 turns) and any creature, other than yourself, that enters or starts its turn in this area must make a Body roll against the 3 dice given. On failure the creature is grappled until the start of your next turn.

175.name: soul hardened spirit animal
175.effect:
Your Spirit Animal gains Ward 2 and 1 Armor stack. 
Additionally, it’s Armor Becomes Medium

176.name: improved animal form
176.effect:
When you Transform through the use of the Animal Form Trait you can gain half of the Creature’s Health as Armor Health. 

Additionally, you can speak normally while transformed and if you have the Nature Speak trait you retain it when transformed.

177.name: updraft
177.effect: Whenever you gain Soul Strain you can Fly (Move your speed in the air) until end of your turn.

178.name: elemental fangs
178.effect:
When you Transform through the use of the Animal Form Trait you can imbue the animal with one of the following effects.
Fire: While transformed your Weapon Attacks inflict an additional 1 Burn, and when you are affected by Burn reduce the number of stacks you gain by 1.
Ice: You can't lose Speed from non magical sources, and take half damage from Water Spells. 
Earth: While transformed do an additional 1 Damage on your Weapon Attacks, and gain the Draw Roots Trait.
Wind: While transformed you get an additional 2 Speed.

179.name: soulbound tree hopper
179.effect: Spend 24 hours binding your Soul to a tree turning it into a Soulbound Tree. While this tree stands you are able to gain 5 Soul Strain and walk into another Soulbound Tree that you know of to teleport yourself, your gear, and something you are holding, to this Soulbound tree. You can have any number of Soulbound Trees.

180.name: frostbite
180.effect: When you effect a creature with Stun, Webbed, or effects that reduce movement, deal 1 damage to them.

181.name: crystalized soul
181.effect: Whenever you gain Soul Strain from the result of casting a spell. Gain 1 Armor Health for every 2 Soul Strain gained.

182.name: stronger flames
182.effect: Non-cantrip Spells that apply Burn apply an additional stack of Burn.

183.name: thorny armor
183.effect: At the end of a Rest make a suit of armor made of thorny vines. This armor gives the wearer an additional 4 Armor Health for every point you have in Nature. While Grappling or when being Grappled give the other target 2 stacks of Bleed at the begining of your turn. This armor counts as Medium Armor (-1 Speed).

184.name: medicinal cooking
184.effect:
Meal's you make with the Cooking action heal any creature that eats them. Travel Meals heal 1 health, Cheap Meals heal 2, Decent Meals heal 3, Rich Meals heal 4, Royal Meals heal 5.
Additionally, you can make Treats instead of Travel Meals. These Treats heal 3 and remove all stacks of Bleeding when eaten. Treats only last 1 day and become mush after this time.

185.name: professional cook
185.effect:
When you make food using the Cooking action you may make 3 more meals than normal. 
Additionally, you may add 4 to any Cooking roll you do.

186.name: blood magic
186.effect: Turn all of your Soul Strain into bonus Max Health. When you where to gain Soul Strain instead take Health Damage equal to the amount gained and don't gain Soul Strain. If you have no Soul Strain you gain an amount of Spells and Max Health equal to twice your Medicine.

187.name: blood shards
187.effect: Gain 2 Soul Strain then shoot shards of blood at a target. Give the target half your level (rounded down) stacks of Bleeding. On a Low Roll reduce the stacks by 1. On a High Roll increase the stacks by 1.

188.name: bloody mess
188.effect:
When you cause a creature to Bleed this turn, heal for how much Bleed you cause. 
Additionally, when trying to roll Charm you get Advantage if you or the creatures are bloody.

189.name: plague doctor
189.effect:
You gain immunity to Poisons.
Additionally, you can use Alchemy Tools to Create poisons using Medicine instead of Arcana.

190.name: placebo
190.effect: Give a Creature within Range 6 an amount of Armor Health equal to your Medicine. You can only do this up to half your Medicine (rounded up) times per Rest.

191.name: trained medic
191.effect:
When you heal with a Bandage or Medkit, increase the healing by your level. 
Additionally, gain Advantage when you roll Identify an Illness or Curse.

192.name: recycled meds
192.effect: You can use Bandages and Medkits twice before they are used.

193.name: medical genius
193.effect: When you use a Medkit on a creature they gain all the benefits of a Rest except for fully healing. (Medkit healing is still the same)

194.name: resuscitate
194.effect:
Touch a creature. You Reduce the target’s Death’s Door Count by 3 to a minimum of 1. 
Additionally, heal the creature as if you used a Medkit. You can do this once per Rest.

195.name: undead thrall
195.effect:
When you use the Create Familiar at the end of a Rest you can instead create a Undead Thrall (See Creatures). This replaces the familiar, dispelling the familiar if one already exists. 
You can control up to your level of personal minions with your dice, but they must all be given the same Command. 
If the Thrall is not given any commands it does not do any action. When you spend a dice to move you may also have the Thrall move as well.

196.name: if these walls could talk
196.effect: Spend a moment at crime scene or dead body, the spirits whisper what happened up to 24 hours prior. You may ask up to 3 questions. The spirits will answer the best they can but will never give more than a rough discription. The spirits also cannot describe something that happend through magic or if it was hidden with magic, such as a creature moving under the Invisibility spell.

197.name: curse of pain
197.effect:
Gain 2 Soul Strain and target a Creature or Object within range 6. Give the target the following Curse. If this target's an object, the curse can affect anyone who touches the object. 
The curse goes away after 1 minute (6 turns), until dispelled by Purge (must beat the number next to the curse), you use this curse on another creature, or the target dies. The target knows you cursed it.
Curse of Pain (6,5): You get Disadvantage on all Checks and Contests for a Skill (Body, Mind, Soul). This skill is chosen by the Curse's Caster. 
Additionally, when you take 3 or more damage (before armor) take an additional damage.

198.name: armor of bones
198.effect: At the end of a Rest make a suit of armor made of bones. This armor gives the wearer an additional 2 Armor Health for every point you have in Medicine. The armor alows the wearer to float in water without the need to swim. This armor counts as Light Armor.

199.name: eyebite
199.effect: When you effect someone with a spell that you cast, you can Blinded them until the start of your next turn.

200.name: curse ward
200.effect:
You get Advantage when rolling to succeed against a Curse or using Purge to remove a Curse. 
Additionally, you can cast Purge once per rest without gaining Soul Strain.

201.name: eyes of the night
201.effect: You can see in poorly light areas as if they were illuminated, and can see through magical darkness. You cannot be blinded by magic.

202.name: undead tinkerer
202.effect: When you cast the spell Raise Undead, Instead of making a Zombie you can make a Shambler, Burster, or Spitter instead.

203.name: curse of bones
203.effect:
Gain 4 Soul Strain and target a Creature or Object within range 6. Give the target the following Curse. You can only use this curse on one target at a time. If this target's an object, the curse can affect anyone who touches the object. 
The curse goes away after 1 minute (6 turns), until dispelled by Purge (must beat the number next to the curse), you use this curse on another creature, or the target dies. The target knows you cursed it.
Curse of Bones (6,5,4): You get Disadvantage on all Checks and Contests for Subskills (Arcana, Charm, Crafting, Nature, Medicine, Thieving).

204.name: curse of fear
204.effect:
Gain 4 Soul Strain and target a Creature or Object within range 6. Give the target the following Curse. You can only use this curse on one target at a time. If this target's an object, the curse can affect anyone who touches the object. 
The curse goes away after 1 minute (6 turns), until dispelled by Purge (must beat the number next to the curse), you use this curse on another creature, or the target dies. The target knows you cursed it.
Curse of Fear (6,5,4): You see things that are not real. At the begining of your turn a terifying visage appears in an empty tile nearby. Roll a dice, On a 1 or 2 you spend your turn runnning from that space trying to hide, On a 3 or 4, spend all dice attacking that space. On a 5, or 6 you act normaly.

205.name: undead king
205.effect:
You do not get attacked by creatures with the Undead type unless you attack them. 
Additionally, you can do a Soul Contest against uncontrolled Undead (No owner) to try to gain control of them. This has no effect on target's with this trait.

206.name: curse of life
206.effect:
Gain 6 Soul Strain and target a Creature or Object within range 6. Give the target the following Curse. You can only use this curse on one target at a time. If this target's an object, the curse can affect anyone who touches the object. 
The curse goes away if dispelled by Purge (must beat the number next to the curse), you use this curse on another creature, or the target dies. The target knows you cursed it.
Curse of Life (6,5,5): You get an additional 50% of your current health (rounded up). But you can nolonger roll Deaths Door Rolls. (You die if you reach 0 or less health)

207.name: conqueror of darkness
207.effect: Reduce the Soul Strain cost by 1 for any Dark Spells you cast. (Dark Spells have the tag Dark) (Curses from traits do not activate this trait) This cannot reduce the cost of spells below 1.

208.name: halo of light
208.effect: Gain 1 Soul Strain. Give a creature Armor Health equal to your Medicine. While they have this Armor Health they Glow as if the spell Glow was cast on them.

209.name: healthy hands
209.effect: When you cast the Healing Hands Spell use your full Medicine roll instead of half.

210.name: holy guardian
210.effect:
When you use the Create Familiar at the end of a Rest you can instead create a Holy Guardian (See Creatures). This replaces the familiar, dispelling the familiar if one already exists. 
You can control up to your level of personal minions with your dice, but they must all be given the same Command. If the guardian is not given any commands it does not do any action. When you spend a dice to move you may also have the guardian move as well.

211.name: soul healer
211.effect: Touch a living creature, cannot target Undead or Constructs. The creature regains Half their max Health. You can do this once per Rest.

212.name: chain healing
212.effect: When you heal a creature you may heal another creature within 1 tile of them for half the healing (rounded down).

213.name: skeleton key
213.effect:
You can Lockpick without needing tools (see Thieves Tools under Items). 
Additionally, you get Advantage when you Lockpick with Thieves Tools.

214.name: thieves abound
214.effect: You know how to talk in special code known only to those who slink in the shadows. When talking to another creature that knows this code you may use Thieving instead of Charm to Convince Someone of Something.

215.name: backstab
215.effect: Do a Melee Attack, the Attack gains Armor Penetration if it does not already have it. If you attack while hidden or from the target's backside do an additional damage.

216.name: sneak thief
216.effect: Reduce the number of tiles you will be detected by by 1, to a minimum of 1. (This effect happens when someone searches.)

217.name: eyes of riches
217.effect: You can see in poorly light areas as if they were illuminated. You can tell the rough value of items with a glance, you can't tell if an item is fake with this trait.

218.name: slap back
218.effect: Spend your locked dice when using this trait. Make a Melee attack on a creature who has hit you with a Melee attack.

219.name: larceny
219.effect: Roll a contested Body Check against a target within 1 tile of you. On success you wrestle an item you can see the target holding or wearing away from them.

220.name: get rough
220.effect: You can push creatures a number of tiles based on your Body +1 instead of just 3 tiles.

221.name: off balance
221.effect: Successful Push actions reduce the target's Speed by half.

222.name: concealed item
222.effect:
You can completely conceal a small item on your person. When you roll Thieving to hide an item on yourself you get Advantage on the roll, and creatures searching you get Disadvantage on their roll. 
Additionally, when you make a Weapon Attack with a concealed weapon, the weapon is not visible.

223.name: silent scaling
223.effect: You make no noise while climbing or falling up to half your Speed, and can climb using Thieving instead of Body.

224.name: in the shadows
224.effect: You can do Hidden Checks with 1 less dice in combat. When you kill a creature while Hidden you do not become revealed.

225.name: hidden in plain sight
225.effect: While disguised, you can roll Thieving instead of Charm to Convince Someone of Something as your disguise.

226.name: assassinate
226.effect: When you do a Melee Weapon attack, after damaging them, if the target has half your Level (rounded up) or less health set their health to 0. If they roll Deaths Door rolls they roll 3 times.

227.name: redirect
227.effect: When you get hit spend your Locked dice to redirect the attack to a creature within 1 tile of you. You cannot do this if there are no creatures within 1 tile of you.

228.name: toys a plenty
228.effect: Use an item that is from your bag, or is within 1 tile of you in the world.

229.name: shadow walk
229.effect: While you are Hidden or unseen you may turn Invisible. This Invisibility lasts until the start of your next turn.

230.name: spell copying
230.effect: If you see a spell being cast by someone else, you temporarily know that spell and how to cast it for 1 minute (6 turns) regardless of if you know the spell innately.

231.name: obscured spell
231.effect: You may roll Hide to conceal the fact that you are casting a spell. You roll against any creature who would see you cast the spell.

232.name: shadow friend
232.effect:
When you use the Create Familiar at the end of a Rest you can instead create a Shadow Friend (See Creatures). This replaces the familiar, dispelling the familiar if one already exists. 
You can control up to your level of personal minions with your dice, but they must all be given the same Command. If the shadow is not given any commands it does not do any action. When you spend a dice to move you may also have the shadow move as well.

233.name: silencing strike
233.effect:
Gain 2 Soul Strain, then make a Weapon Attack. Give the target a Stack of Silence. If you activate the effect of your weapon give them 2 stacks of Silence instead. 
Alternatively you can do no damage to the target and give 3 stacks instead.

234.name: spell disarmament
234.effect: You can spend 1 minute casting Dispel Magic with Thieves’ tools without gaining Soul Strain.

235.name: now you see me
235.effect: When you do the Move action while under the effects of a movement based spell or Soul trait you are Invisible.

236.name: spell thief
236.effect:
If you successfully Counterspell a Spell. You can Cast that spell for half its Soul Strain cost (rounded up) on your next turn.
Additionally, you can gain 2 Soul Strain to learn 1 random spell from creature you can see, you know this spell for 1 hour.

237.name: body possession
237.effect: You can take over another humanoids living body for up to 10 minutes. The affected creature must be unconscious and will wake up if it takes damage. At the end of the effect, if you choose to leave the body, or if the creature wakes up from damage, you are booted to the nearest safe tile next to the creature. You cannot enter the same creature for 1 day after using this effect on them.
